description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Manchester's Hidden Gems" â€” a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Manchester's Hidden Gems

places.generalDescription: The Botanical Garden is a large indoor-outdoor space featuring themed groupings of international plant species, ponds, and even a cafe. Visitors can also explore the Scent Garden designed for individuals with visual impairments and wheelchair accessibility. The garden offers a peaceful and calming atmosphere, making it an ideal place to relax and connect with nature. It's recommended for those seeking shade on sunny days or interested in plant and bee spotting.

sources.snippet: Established in 1814 by Oslo University, the Botaniskhage or simply Botanical Garden is the oldest botanical garden, not just in Oslo, but in the whole of Norway. Home to 7,500 species of plants, spending time here is one of the top things to do in Norway and is good not just for any nature-lover, but also for any keen Instagrammer with a succulent addiction.
sources.shortName: 27 UNIQUE Things to Do in Oslo [in 2024]

places.name: The Botanical Garden

reviews.text: The botanical garden is a peaceful and serene area for all nature lovers. We visited during a warm spring day and it was just perfect. The garden is very well maintained and offers many various environments. There are three greenhouses that are worth visiting.

I loved it here. Every year, April to September, I'd be looking so much forward to my evening dog walks. It was so peaceful and calming. Now I absolutely hate it as I see all the people and kids sitting on fields where they're not supposed to, picking flowers that they were not supposed to, while they forbid dogs who were just happy to smell and frolick around. This is such a sad decision.

It was a very interesting experience. The botanical garden is well maintained, there is a map with all the paths and places to visit. I especially liked the exposition with stones, as well as the greenhouses. There is a cafe on the territory, there are gazebos, as well as a "hotel for insects"

places.generalDescription: The Oslo Opera House is a striking and contemporary architectural masterpiece located by the waterfront. It serves as the home to the Norwegian National Opera & Ballet. Designed by Snohetta, it resembles a glacier floating in the Oslofjord and is considered one of Scandinavia's most iconic buildings. The interior can be fully appreciated through guided tours, offering insights into its thoughtful design that reflects Norway's cultural significance and public engagement.

sources.snippet: Finally, while performances at most of Osloâ€™s theatres, such as Nationaltheatret, Folketeatret and Det norske teatret, are usually in Norwegian, the beautiful Oslo Opera has a varied array of orchestral, operatic and ballet performances on offer â€“ which usually do not require knowledge of Norwegian to be enjoyed to their fullest. During the (summer) day, you can spend a lazy hour at the top of the building, soaking in the sun and finding out where to head next.
sources.shortName: A Couple's Guide To Oslo, Norway

sources.snippet: Whether youâ€™re arriving by train, or bus, you will almost definitely start your Oslo trip at Oslo Central Station. And right next to the station happens to be one of the most famous sites in Oslo: the Oslo Opera House.
sources.shortName: 37 Top Things to Do in Oslo - From a Local!

sources.snippet: Conclude your romantic tour of Oslo with a night at the Oslo Opera House. Attend a ballet or opera performance in this architectural marvel, and let the music and drama cap off your romantic adventure.
sources.shortName: Oslo for Lovers: Discover the City's Top 8 Romantic Experiences

places.name: Oslo Opera House

reviews.text: It certainly is one of the most beautiful as well as functional public buildings in any capital city. The design of the Opera house to encourage people to walk along around and on top of them is somewhat of an architectural genius, particularly with it being right on the waterfront. The building certainly seems to have become a tourist and local favourite since its construction within the last decade from memory.

The Oslo Opera House is truly a masterpiece of modern architecture and one of the most iconic landmarks in the city. The design of the building is breathtaking - with its white marble and glass faÃ§ade, it looks like it rises straight out of the Oslo Fjord. The sloping roof is unique and inviting, allowing visitors to walk all the way up and enjoy stunning views of the city and the water.

Inside, the Opera House is just as impressive. The spacious, light-filled interiors combine elegance with functionality, creating the perfect atmosphere for cultural performances. The use of wood and natural materials adds warmth and harmony, beautifully contrasting with the sleek, modern exterior.

It's not only a place for world-class opera and ballet, but also a public space where everyone can enjoy art, architecture, and the city's waterfront. The Oslo Opera House is a perfect example of how design can blend beauty, culture, and accessibility.

A must-see when visiting Oslo - whether for a performance or simply to experience one of the most stunning architectural landmarks in Scandinavia.

Beautiful venue! The modern and sleek architecture is flowing, yet angular. Inside, the all wood finish brings warmth and softness. It's a piece of art for the arts! We happened to catch one of the last shows for The Day After Yesterday and it was amazing! Awesome performers and choreography. If you get a chance to catch a show here, do so!

places.generalDescription: Statholdergaarden is housed in a 16th-century building and offers an exceptional dining experience. The food is described as special, beautiful, and tasty, with a large tasting menu that showcases a variety of delicious dishes. The service is highly attentive, with staff anticipating needs before they are even expressed. Guests have praised the impeccable service team and the chef's personal interaction. While it may be expensive, many find it worth the cost for the high standards maintained by the restaurant.

sources.snippet: Statholdergaarden is a renowned Michelin-starred restaurant located in Oslo, Norway. With its elegant and intimate atmosphere, it offers a unique dining experience. The menu showcases a fusion of traditional Norwegian and international cuisine, prepared with the finest ingredients, resulting in exquisite and innovative dishes.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaway in Oslo for Couples

places.name: Statholdergaarden

reviews.text:
Ah, the delightful paradox that is Statholdergaarden-where the outside whispers restraint, and the inside bursts into an opulent embrace of history and flavor.

From the street, the austere exterior gave little away, its simplicity almost daring us to underestimate what lay within. But stepping through those doors? It was like entering another world-one of hand-painted ceilings, rich plasterwork, and a grandeur that seemed to have been plucked from another era. The Cleopatra Room, where we dined, was particularly mesmerizing, her regal gaze both alluring and imperious, watching over our indulgence with an expression that might have been judgmentâ€¦ or approval.

The meal itself was a symphony of surprise, each course revealing unexpected combinations that somehow felt both daring and inevitable. Ingredients that had no business being on the same plate danced together in perfect balance, showcasing the kitchen's playfulness and precision.

And the wine pairing? Not just recommended-essential. Each pour was a revelation, transforming good dishes into extraordinary ones, adding layers of complexity that teased and delighted the palate.

But perhaps the real magic of Statholdergaarden lay in the service-gracious, intuitive, and effortlessly refined. The team anticipated our every need, guiding us through the experience with the kind of hospitality that turns a meal into a memory.

It was our last night in Oslo, and we couldn't have asked for a more fitting farewell-a place that reminded us that things are not always as they seem. Understated on the outside, unforgettable on the inside-Statholdergaarden is a hidden treasure in the heart of the city.

Amazing dining experience.  On par with best Michelin restaurants in the US.  Definitely need to add to your list of restaurants to visit when in Oslo.  The homemade sourdough bread was amazing and need to be careful not to eat too much before appetizers and main dishes.  Had the 10 course and took 3 plus hours and had great conversations and got to know the staff by end of night.

Dining at Statholdergaarden on February 26 was a beautiful and thoughtful journey through Nordic flavors, presented with elegance and precision. I had the full tasting menu, which unfolded over the course of about two hours - a perfectly paced experience that never felt rushed.

The house bread was simply outstanding - made with a sourdough starter they've been feeding for seven years! The first amuse-bouche looked stunning, though the flavor was more subtle. The morel course had layers of earthy complexity - maybe a bit too complex for my taste, but still interesting. The winter cod was a highlight: perfectly cooked, with a sauce that reminded me of ginger and orange - bright and deeply flavorful. A small extra sorbet followed as a refreshing intermezzo.

The veal, served as the main, was tasty but a bit heavy, and I would've appreciated a more generous side to balance the dish. The cheese course truly impressed - with combinations like honey and basil, an aged Italian balsamic-like liqueur, and sherry-caramelized raisins soaked in honey. Each pairing was clever, sweet, and memorable.

Dessert brought a refreshing end, and the petit fours were delicate and satisfying.

A refined, two-hour Michelin-starred experience that beautifully balances Norwegian tradition with creativity. A must-visit in Oslo for anyone who loves thoughtful, detailed cuisine.

places.generalDescription: Brasserie France is a French-style restaurant located in the heart of Oslo, offering traditional cuisine in a setting that resembles the ambiance of Paris. The three-level brasserie features sidewalk terrace tables where guests can enjoy the delightful French atmosphere. The waitstaff is known for being friendly and helpful, providing top-notch service reminiscent of dining experiences in Paris. While the menu may not offer many vegan options, the accommodating kitchen can prepare special dishes upon request.

sources.snippet: Brasserie France in Oslo, Norway is a charming French restaurant that offers a delightful culinary experience. With its cozy ambiance, attentive service, and a menu featuring classic French dishes prepared with fresh ingredients, it is a perfect spot to indulge in a taste of France in the heart of Oslo.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaway in Oslo for Couples

places.name: Brasserie France

reviews.text:
The restaurant is so welcoming! they have options for any kind of diet whether gluten free only or seafood or anything you can imagine. their dessert is so delicious, the vibes of the restaurant and everything there was breathtaking!
I definitely recommend this restaurant for anyone who fancy a luxurious dinner ðŸ¥˜

Classic French food in a nice part of Oslo. We had a 3 course with a cured meat platter, duck for main, and crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e for dessert. The food was well prepared and presented, but perhaps a bit rich for me (not a problem if you have a big appetite!).

The noise level wasn't great. We were on the second floor and it was difficult to speak with the person across the table without shouting.

Servers were efficient and friendly. It's a nice restaurant for a more formal dinner, though is probably pick a more quiet time of the day if I came back.
Nice French inspired restaurant on the center of Oslo.  In the end of the food we have dessert in the lounge on the second floor. Nice pastries with the cofee

places.generalDescription: KOK Oslo Sauna, located at Langkaia, is a unique floating sauna experience established in 2017. The sauna offers two boats where visitors can relax while enjoying stunning views of the Opera House and the fjord. Guests have the option to take a refreshing dip in the icy fjord after their sauna session. While there are no private changing rooms or bathrooms on site, visitors can book shared saunas and enjoy meeting new people from around the world.

sources.snippet: Thereâ€™s SALT â€“ one of the largest saunas in the world-slash-nomadic art project, complete with weekend afterparties; KOK, a sauna boat; alternatively, try out Oslo Sauna Raft, which literally floats out at in the fjord. Certainly one of the more unusual things to do in Oslo, but all the same definitely one of the coolest!
sources.shortName: 27 UNIQUE Things to Do in Oslo [in 2024]

sources.snippet: SALT is the most accessible, though KOK and PUST are equally exceptional. Alternatively, you could consider renting a floating sauna with a skipper to navigate you across the Oslo Fjord for a few hours. Yet, in keeping with Norwegian tradition, it's imperative to immerse yourself in the frigid waters.
sources.shortName: Destination: a stay in Oslo during winter; incredibly romantic and not what you would expect
37 Top Things to Do in Oslo - From a Local!

places.name: KOK Oslo Sauna, Langkaia

reviews.text:
Amazing! The sauna was very nice and the water was very chill, exactly what you need to cold down after 20mn under 80â„ƒ! You can jump from above the sauna which is very fun. I went there alone and booked the shared sauna, we were only 6 inside so it was not too crowded, there can be up to 8 people inside , which would also be very acceptable as the saunas are quite big.
There is no Â«Â privateÂ Â» changing room

What a lovely experience! Michael welcomed us and was very informative and helpful. Luckily, we ended up being just us two in the sauna so we were able to put on some music and make the most of it. Bonus points for the refreshing light beer. Definitely a highlight of our stay so far!

We had a brilliant time at the Sauna. We visited as a family of 4 and booked a private sauna. We loved jumping in to cool down and the views were great. A really fun thing to do as a family. Great service too!

places.generalDescription: Munch Museum in Oslo houses over 26,000 works of art by Munch along with his personal effects and tools. The city also offers a plethora of attractions including the National Gallery, smaller cafes, restaurants, and bars with live music such as Bare Jazz and Cafe Sor. Additionally, Oslo boasts various theaters like Nationaltheatret and Folketeatret where performances are usually in Norwegian.

sources.snippet: Oslo has a lot of great museums and galleries to explore once you know where to find them; look out for special events and exhibitions in places like the Munch Museum and the National Gallery. Youâ€™ll also find a lot of cute smaller cafÃ©s, restaurants and bars, some of which offer live music on certain nights, such as Bare Jazz and Cafe SÃ¸r. Finally, while performances at most of Osloâ€™s theatres, such as Nationaltheatret, Folketeatret and Det norske teatret, are usually in Norwegian, the beautiful Oslo Opera has a varied array of orchestral, operatic and ballet performances on offer â€“ which usually do not require knowledge of Norwegian to be enjoyed to their fullest.
sources.shortName: A Couple's Guide To Oslo, Norway

sources.snippet: I donâ€™t tend to enjoy museums, but I really liked the new Munch museum right along the harbor. Rather than a traditional art museum with pictures on walls, it had several exhibits that were much more interactive. One floor was a heavy metal music concert inspired by various works on display, and another was a labyrinth where you were actually encouraged to scribble on the walls.
sources.shortName: my favorite spots

sources.snippet: For art enthusiast couples, a visit to the Munch Museum is a must. Home to the largest collection of Edvard Munch's works, the museum offers a deep dive into the artist's passionate and emotive artistry.
sources.shortName: Oslo for Lovers: Discover the City's Top 8 Romantic Experiences
37 Top Things to Do in Oslo - From a Local!

places.name: Munch

reviews.text: I came here with my mum and we had a lovely time. You are not allowed to bring backpacks into the gallery, but there are lockers at the entrance where you can securely store them whilst enjoying the exhibitions. I thought the layouts of the exhibitions were great and there was an interesting story told through the art and additional artifacts. The cafe in the lobby serves lovely coffee and baked goods and the top floor bar is a must for fantastic views over the Opera and surrounding area. The only negative we experienced was the price we had to pay for an umbrella in the gift shop when the weather unexpectedly turned wet.

The Munch Museum in the Barcode district is spectacular. The architecture of the building inside and out is really impressive and the views from the top floor, you can see Oslo city and the small islands dotted around. There is three floors with an escalator to each to see all his art work and on the ground floor is lockers for your bags before entering and a lovely cafe with indoor and outdoor sitting on the water.

The Munch Museum is impressive for the size of its collection and its modern building with beautiful views of Oslo. You can see different versions of The Scream, monumental works like The Sun and rare drawings. There is a great gift shop (5 postcards for 100 kroner). A great place to immerse yourself in Munch.

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Kontrast, located in the revitalized Vulkan industrial area, offers a New Nordic dining experience. Chef Mikael Svensson and his team have established strong partnerships with local artisanal producers to create a menu featuring mid-sized dishes made from the region's finest ingredients. The restaurant's stark and trendy space provides the backdrop for an exceptional culinary journey. Guests praise the exemplary service and unparalleled food quality, particularly highlighting the incredible use of fermentation and impressive wine pairings.

sources.snippet: Kontrast in Oslo, Norway is a renowned Michelin-starred restaurant that offers a unique dining experience. With a focus on locally sourced ingredients and innovative cooking techniques, Kontrast delivers beautifully presented dishes that showcase the flavors of Norwegian cuisine. The restaurant's minimalist decor and attentive service create an intimate and memorable atmosphere.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaway in Oslo for Couples

places.name: Restaurant Kontrast

reviews.text: Out of all the michelins, this one takes the cake. Even with one vegetarian menu, we've never had such attentive service and varied dishes. Divine flavours and just an overall calm vibe of the place. They are experts in their art.

While pricey, one of the best meals I've had. Great dining and culinary experience with local Norwegian ingredients made with care and expertise. At one point, i was more impressed by the creativity of how many steps it took to prepare one part of one dish!

The dinner took quite a bit of time, but did not seemed slow or rushed. The service was excellent - not pretentious - my questions were answered genuinely.

Too many delicious courses to name favorites, or remember how they were prepared. If you have the chance, and the funds, a must go! (With a wine pairing!)

I visited Kontrast on my 29th birthday with my girlfriend. The moment you walk into this restaurant, you immediately feel like someone special. The staff gives you their full attention. As soon as they see you've finished, they appear at your table right away and suggest the next courses. They really know their craft. They can answer any question and are happy to chat about anything. The dishes were exquisite. You absolutely must order the drinks paired with each dish - it really elevates the whole experience. The chefs work with incredible focus. It's definitely worth going there, as it's something completely different from an ordinary night out at a restaurant.
I will come back.

places.generalDescription: Nestled just a stone's throw from the iconic Rockefeller Music Hall, Arakataka is a vibrant culinary gem that celebrates seasonal Nordic and international flavors. This contemporary eatery features an open kitchen and stylish designer lighting, creating an inviting atmosphere for diners. The heart of Arakataka lies in its Matbaren food bar, where guests can indulge in a delightful selection of small plates without the need for reservations.

sources.snippet: Known for its innovative and modern Nordic cuisine, it offers a unique dining experience with a focus on locally sourced ingredients. With a stylish and cozy atmosphere, Arakataka is a popular choice for food enthusiasts seeking a taste of contemporary Norwegian gastronomy.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaway in Oslo for Couples

places.name: Arakataka

reviews.text: This was our last meal in Oslo. The restaurant was very nice. It was during the Easter holiday and this is one of the only restaurants opened so we felt very grateful. The food was wonderful and apparently the wine selection is quite extensive in general. A very, very nice experience would recommend.

Having such a wonderful dinner here! I went for the 4-course tasting menu, and it really had the perfect summer vibe.
My favourite was the raw halibut â€“ light, refreshing, and beautifully layered with just the right touch of bitterness from the herbs. The dessert was also lovely: the almond cream balanced the tartness of the berries and left us with a refreshing, light finish to the meal.
The squash was absolutely amazing too, though I wasn't as keen on the sauce. Overall, I'm really satisfied with this meal ðŸ’›

Nice place - booked out on a Tuesday night - pleasant crowd in their late 20s to 40s; lucky we had reserved a table. Modern tastefully designed restaurant (lots of wood), the wine list excellent (strong in French wines). We had a fairly priced 4-course menu and were positively surprised by nordic-creative  cuisine ! Starting with delicous oysters / halibut (?) the second course' green aspargus with a whey based slightly sour aroma sauce was top notch. The chicken course was crunchy (reminded me a bit of a nordicinterpretation of Beijing duck) and the caramelle aroma of the desert remakable. Yes service could be more warm ... but i always prefer professional cold over US style fake friendliness ... All in all: Very nice evening  !!

places.generalDescription: Maaemo is a chic, fine dining restaurant in Oslo that offers a seasonal Norwegian menu with wine pairings in a minimalist setting. The name "Maaemo" translates to "Mother Earth," reflecting the restaurant's focus on authentic Norwegian nature and culture. With only eight tables, Maaemo provides an intimate dining experience where guests can enjoy over 20 courses featuring traditional Scandinavian cuisine made from local produce.

sources.snippet: Maaemo is a renowned three-Michelin-starred restaurant in Oslo, Norway. It offers a unique and innovative dining experience, focusing on locally sourced ingredients and sustainable practices. With a minimalist and elegant setting, Maaemo showcases the best of Norwegian cuisine, delivering exceptional flavors and culinary artistry.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaway in Oslo for Couples

places.name: Maaemo

reviews.text:
There's a reason why they have 3 Michelin Stars. The quality of the food was simply amazing. The skill involved in creating every single dish was just phenomenal. Surprisingly, the one thing that really stood out was the butter for the bread. How, how is it so good??
Although, the service/front of house team was left to be desired. Glasses left empty and overall felt like they needed more organisation.
The space itself is simply gorgeous. We had a good view of the kitchen, and to see the chefs work their magic with the hibachi grill was awesome. The price itself is steep, but it's well worth it.
Side note. Strangely, the toilet felt like I could stay in it for a massage.

I don't like to write negatively about three-star restaurants, but I was very disappointed with this pride of our nation, Norway's best restaurant. Starting with the rushed service and lack of proper wine recommendations, we were already half an hour into our main courses. Then we were invited to a room in the basement. I understand that the second service scheduled for 9:00 PM forced us to be in such a hurry, but they also forgot to serve us one of the dishes, and there were only 13 of them. The food was great, but something wasn't quite right. It's a pleasure to go to such restaurants. We flew in from Poland specifically for this. Something didn't quite work, but we're not discouraged; maybe we'll try again next year. We send our regards to the entire staff, asking for improvement. We were there on August 13th.

Unbelievable menu, some of the most enticing and imaginative flavors, textures, and ingredient combinations I've ever experienced! The ambience is singularly unique, with a clean yet warm atmosphere. The service was elevated and fluid yet never stuffy. We were so pampered! Oh, I highly recommend the juice pairing. Such a thrilling meal I will NEVER forget.

sources.snippet: Youâ€™ll also find a lot of cute smaller cafÃ©s, restaurants and bars, some of which offer live music on certain nights, such as Bare Jazz and Cafe SÃ¸r. Finally, while performances at most of Osloâ€™s theatres, such as Nationaltheatret, Folketeatret and Det norske teatret, are usually in Norwegian, the beautiful Oslo Opera has a varied array of orchestral, operatic and ballet performances on offer â€“ which usually do not require knowledge of Norwegian to be enjoyed to their fullest. During the (summer) day, you can spend a lazy hour at the top of the building, soaking in the sun and finding out where to head next.
sources.shortName: A Couple's Guide To Oslo, Norway

reviews.text:
One of the coolest music store in the town with a bar in the second floor.
Where you can find different kind of exclusive records.
There are tables in the second floor and also open area with 15-20 tables for the people who want to have their drink and smoke in the same time.
In the heart of the city with very calm and silent atmosphere.

The atmosphere in this place is so cozy; brick walls, dim lights, lit candles and great coffee. In the summer you can even sit outside, which I love. This is also a great place for those who are into jazz music; jazz concerts are held here some evenings, and they sell jazz records which you can listen to on the first floor if you want to.
Fantastic place for a cup or beer. Id 22 after 19:00, great space outside with heating lamps. The store on the first floor touts itself as "Scandinavia's biggest in jazz on CD"!

sources.snippet: Stock up for your island picnics at Annis Oslobukta, an upscale butcher and deli in the Oslobukta neighbourhood. Here, youâ€™ll find a treasure trove of fine foods and local delicacies, including cheeses, preserved fruits, seafood, meats, and that beloved Norwegian delicacy, lutefisk. Sate your appetite at SAVAGE:
sources.shortName: Your Coupleâ€™s Guide to the Best Things to Do in Oslo, Norway

reviews.text: Great staff and very helpful. High quality of meats

Although my online order somehow had disappeared in the system, they solved it quickly. Annies is a well stocked butchery, with a great selection of Cheeses, and even some high end seafoods like king crab. They also dry age their meats to perfection.
This place is amazing.  Great variety of cuts, aged and fresh.  Fish and seafood.  Service A+.  Well worth the visit.

places.generalDescription: If you're looking for a reliable and budget-friendly way to travel between Copenhagen and Oslo, the Miami Bus service is an excellent choice. This comfortable bus option not only offers scenic views along the route but also features friendly drivers who are eager to share insights about Norway's culture and attractions. Many travelers have praised the Miami Bus for its affordability compared to other transport options like shuttles, making it a perfect fit for students or anyone on a budget.

sources.snippet: Taking the bus from Copenhagen, Denmark to Oslo is a comfortable and scenic option. Companies like Eurolines and Swebus offer daily services from Copenhagen to Oslo.
sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - A romantic day trip to Oslo, Norway

places.name: Miami Bus

reviews.text: As an Erasmus student i used to travel various places with a limited budget and this service system.literally saved me having Norway a nightmare. Our driver Peter was so friendly, nice and kind. He helped a lot and introduced various places during our way to Oslo. And he offered much more affordable way of bus compared to shuttle etc. Thank you, and advice it to everyone!!
Very nice trip. Friendly and helpful driver Robert ðŸ‘

We couldn't be more grateful for the Miami bus service. The driver was super friendly, he told us about life in Norway and its most interesting points to visit. And to top it off, he left us at the door of our destination. All for an irresistible price. I would definitely hire the services of Miami Bus again. Thank you very much!!!^^

The best place to take a walk any season, very good for swimming in summertime and lots of space to grill or hang out, read a book or go for a hike from here! Lots of parking and they have ice cream and waffles. The walk is approximately 3 km around the lake and there are lots of places to jump in from. There are cows and sheep at the northern side and small streams.
One of the best spots in Oslo for a walk, swim and relax. During the summer weekend and public holidays it gets a little bit crowded but nothing crazy
Amazing lake to see .. available to camping , there is a shop to buy a hot coffee and some snack ðŸ˜‹

places.generalDescription: Cafe SÃ¸r is a versatile and laid-back cafÃ© by day, transforming into a vibrant bar with live music and DJ sets at night. This Oslo favorite offers an intimate setting for coffee dates or lively evenings of cocktails and dancing with friends. The cafe hosts various events throughout the week, including swing dancing, salsa nights, bachata, and kizomba. Guests can enjoy delicious salads, soups, apple cake, as well as a selection of coffee and tea.

sources.snippet: Youâ€™ll also find a lot of cute smaller cafÃ©s, restaurants and bars, some of which offer live music on certain nights, such as Bare Jazz and Cafe SÃ¸r. Finally, while performances at most of Osloâ€™s theatres, such as Nationaltheatret, Folketeatret and Det norske teatret, are usually in Norwegian, the beautiful Oslo Opera has a varied array of orchestral, operatic and ballet performances on offer â€“ which usually do not require knowledge of Norwegian to be enjoyed to their fullest. During the (summer) day, you can spend a lazy hour at the top of the building, soaking in the sun and finding out where to head next.
sources.shortName: A Couple's Guide To Oslo, Norway

places.name: Cafe SÃ¸r

reviews.text: Lots of dancing, cool music and a great friendly vibe. The staff did a great job keeping hooligans outside. Ok prices. We sat outside in October and it was actually warm under the heat lamps.

DJ Patrik and DJ D absolutely killed it on the decks - the energy was insane all night.
Special shout-out to Dani - my man! Great service, chill vibe, and always with a smile.
Definitely coming back
One of the best cafes I've ever been to, with chill music, a lovely guy working behind the bar and its own tea bag making station!

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Hot Shop, a Scandinavian eatery helmed by Noma alumnus Chef Jo Boe Klakegg, offers a simple yet exquisite dining experience. The menu features dishes like white asparagus in parsley and spinach sauce, Norwegian scallops, and milk ice cream with black currant. In 2022, the restaurant was awarded a Michelin star for its exceptional cuisine. The relaxed atmosphere and competent staff make for an enjoyable dining experience.

sources.snippet: Embark on a culinary adventure housed in a former adult store transformed into a gastronomic haven (they kept the name: Hot Shop). No lube, but steaming seafood making it a sensual gastronomic experience. No really, utterly de-li-cious!.
sources.shortName: Destination: a stay in Oslo during winter; incredibly romantic and not what you would expect

places.name: Restaurant Hot Shop

reviews.text: Had the vegetarian set menu. They starred decadent buttery vegetables with well paired acidic sauces and consommÃ©s. Was a fun delight. The staff had a casual demeanor and were very accommodating and attentive, enhancing the whole experience!

Nice and cozy place. Amazing bread with thyme butter! Highlight of the meal was the celery root with truffle, absolutely delicious. Unfortunately it took almost half an hour between the main courses and service just felt too slow and thus affected the entire experience.

Hands down the best scallops I have had in my life. First time for sea urchin, and many combinations I never would have thought would go well together until now.
Chef is a "balansekunstner" and yellow saus master. ðŸ‘ðŸ¼ Wonderful local restaurant I would love to visit again!

sources.snippet: If you fancy a more laid-back approach, as opposed to a 7-course extravaganza, then consider Nektar Vinbar (that is if you have an affinity for wine). Here, they serve the most exceptional wines from the tiniest, unique wine nooks of Europe. Many natural wines, unfiltered as such, yet you'll also find your familiar Burgundy here.
sources.shortName: Destination: a stay in Oslo during winter; incredibly romantic and not what you would expect

reviews.text: What a wonderful authentic family run restaurant with local and true simple and delicious food. I have been introduced by my dear friend Elise a local with great goody radar. We were super lucky to get a table on a Friday night. Fantastic welcome, atmosphere and truly fantastic food and wine that straddle tradition and modern tastes. We shared the anchovy toast  and loved the burger and venison. If you are visiting Oslo make this a must. Tak!

Nektar is one of those very special places that you should make sure to experience in Oslo. Make reservations- it's small and very busy. We had a group of 6 so we let them choose our plates and the wine. We started with their house classic Anchovy Toast and it was incredible. Dish after dish was excellent- locally sourced ingredients (honey from the hives down the street- yes really local) and creative interpretations of classics, like Mac & Cheese.

The wine pairing was also great. The food was so incredible we almost forgot how perfectly the wine  accompanied our dishes.

Overall it was fantastic- make this one of your special places when you're in Oslo.

Wonderfully located at the bottom of beautiful Damstredet alley in one of the old Norwegian traditional houses, good atmosphere (although modern music, expected a more classy sound like jazz or something to resonate with the place), great kind and knowledgeable service, nice wine variety and absolutely delicious food. Portions are smaller and meant for sharing, but totally worth it. Homemade Halloumi is indeed super special, best ever. Mushrooms gnocchi was also a treat.
All in all, great experience.
Reservations recommended.

places.generalDescription: Ã…pent Bakeri Barcode is a local favorite in Oslo, offering a variety of handmade bread, pastries, and sandwiches. The cozy ambiance makes it perfect for a breakfast stop. One must-try item is the Yolainys steak sandwich, featuring perfectly grilled steak on artisanal bread with fresh vegetables and savory sauce. Visitors praise the delicious croissants, cardamom buns, and solid coffee.

sources.snippet: Weâ€™d go to great lengths for the perfect kanelboller (cinnamon bun), but fortunately Ã…pent has locations dotted all over Oslo!. This popular local bakery chain offers artisan bread, delicious sandwiches and cakes, and a cosy atmosphere. See also Mendelâ€™s or organic bakery chain Godt BrÃ¸d (good bread) for coffee and delicious pastries.
sources.shortName: Your Coupleâ€™s Guide to the Best Things to Do in Oslo, Norway

places.name: Ã…pent Bakeri Barcode

reviews.text: Great breakfast for when you want something more than the usual selection of pastries and baked goods. Coffee was delicious!

I usually love this place, especially for breakfast, but my recent visits have been a bit disappointing. The avocado toast recipe changed â€“ no more tomatoes, (I preferred it with tomatoes) especially since the price has gone up (though I understand the price increase). Service was off: our cappuccinos came as lattes. When our food was ready, it sat on the serving counter for a while, but the buzzer didn't work, so we only noticed it by chance. Unfortunately, it had already gotten cold. The bread was also over-fried â€“ the edges were so hard it was difficult to cut, even though I normally love their bread. Overall, it wasn't terrible, but it was definitely worse than usual. There was way too much salt on the eggs, you can visually notice that there is too much flakes. I also ordered a cappuccino to go, and even though they said it was a cappuccino, it tasted more like a latte â€“ very milky with a lot of foam. I've had cappuccinos here many times before, and this one just didn't match the usual.

My Daily Ritual at Ã…pent Bakeri: A Consistently Delightful Experience
As a visitor to Oslo, I've found my daily ritual at Ã…pent Bakeri, and it has quickly become a highlight of my trip. This marks my third consecutive day here, and each visit has been nothing short of fantastic. My go-to order-coffee and avocado toast with two extra eggs-has been consistently delicious. The food quality is superb, always fresh, and perfectly seasoned.
The staff here truly stands out. They are incredibly friendly and warm, always making me feel welcome. While they're open to customizing orders, I've found that the original balance of the dishes is so thoughtfully crafted that any changes can slightly disrupt the harmony. For a coffee and meal, expect to pay around 250 KR, and for a quick pick-up, it's typically between 150 and 200 KR.
Even on weekday mornings, Ã…pent Bakeri is bustling, a testament to its popularity among locals. The crowd is often well-dressed and appears quite content, whether they're deep in conversation or focused on their work. This lively atmosphere, combined with the visible communication between the chef and assistant to ensure order accuracy, creates a confident and efficient vibe.
Cleanliness is paramount to me, and Ã…pent Bakeri consistently meets my high standards. The bathroom is always well-maintained with stocked soap, which I believe speaks volumes about a business's commitment to overall hygiene and healthy practices. Out in the main area, the food display is impeccably organized, and I've never observed any cross-contamination of pastries.
Beyond my beloved avocado toast-where the perfectly cooked, runny egg and balanced portions of avocado, bread, mayo, and seasoning shine-I've also indulged in their pancakes and chocolate scone. The pancakes were soft, fluffy, and thick, served with fresh, juicy berries. While I wished for one more pancake, I appreciate that you can easily add an extra. The chocolate scone was also a treat: thick, delightfully crumbly on the outside, and soft on the inside.
While the coffee is good and certainly gets the job done, it might not be considered "top shelf." However, this is a minor detail in an otherwise exceptional experience. Expect a short line for ordering, usually 2 to 5 minutes, but rest assured the staff are excellent listeners and always verify your order with care.
Ã…pent Bakeri has truly won me over with its delicious food, warm service, vibrant atmosphere, and unwavering commitment to quality. It's clear why it's a local favorite, and I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a truly authentic and enjoyable bakery experience in Oslo.
